title: 110_hr7083
content: The Charity Enhancement Act of 2008, also known as the "Act," amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act includes a table of contents outlining its provisions. The Charity Enhancement Act of 2008, also known as the "Act," includes provisions such as funds advised by certain public charities and governmental entities not treated as donor advised funds, scholarship distributions from donor advised funds not treated as taxable distributions, repeal of special written acknowledgment requirement for charitable contributions to donor advised funds, reasonable compensation paid by supporting organizations to substantial contributors not treated as an excess benefit, exception from holdings and payout requirements for longstanding, fully funded type III supporting organizations, and contributions by Indian tribal governments treated same as contributions by States. Expansion of bad check penalty to electronic payments and electronic filing of exempt organization annual returns are included in the Charity Enhancement Act of 2008. Contributions by Indian tribal governments are treated the same as contributions by States. SEC. 2. FUNDS ADVISED BY CERTAIN PUBLIC CHARITIES AND GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES NOT TREATED AS DONOR ADVISED FUNDS. Amendment to section 4966(d)(2) allows contributions and advisory privileges to be made by specific organizations or entities as outlined in the new clause (iii). The amendments made by this section, described in section 170(c)(1), will apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. Certain scholarship distributions from donor advised funds will not be treated as taxable distributions. Certain scholarship distributions from donor advised funds are exempt from being considered taxable distributions. This exemption applies to qualified scholarship distributions from qualified scholarship funds, meeting specific requirements. The advisory privileges for a fund must be exercised by a tax-exempt organization, and most distributions from the fund must be qualified scholarship distributions. Substantial contributors to qualified scholarship funds are subject to tax on prohibited benefits. The amendments made by this section apply to distributions from qualified scholarship funds after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF SPECIAL WRITTEN ACKNOWLEDGMENT REQUIREMENT FOR CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO DONOR ADVISED FUNDS. This section amends paragraph (18) of section 170(f) by removing certain requirements related to donor advised funds. The effective date for these changes is for taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. Reasonable compensation paid by supporting organizations to substantial contributors not treated as an excess benefit. The amendment to section 4958(c)(3)(A) expands the definition of 'excess benefit' to include the amount of grants, loans, or similar payments, as well as compensation exceeding the value of the economic benefit provided. The amendment made by this section applies to transactions entered into after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 6. EXCEPTION FROM HOLDINGS AND PAYOUT REQUIREMENTS FOR LONGSTANDING, FULLY FUNDED TYPE III SUPPORTING ORGANIZATIONS. The amendment exempts certain longstanding fully funded type III supporting organizations from holdings and payout requirements. The organization must have been established before January 1, 1970, not accepted substantial contributions after December 31, 1970, have no living donors as of August 17, 2006, and no family member of a donor can be an organization manager. The Protection Act of 2006 does not apply to organizations described in section 4943(f)(8) of the Internal Revenue Code. The amendments made by this section will be effective for taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 7. Contributions by Indian tribal governments treated same as contributions by states. Section 7871(a) is amended to include provisions for determining support of certain organizations and their status for tax purposes. These amendments apply to support received after the enactment date and the status determination of organizations for taxable years after that date. The amendments to Section 7871(a) determine support for organizations and their tax status for taxable years after the enactment date. SEC. 8. ELECTRONIC FILING OF EXEMPT ORGANIZATION ANNUAL RETURNS. In section 6104, amendments are made regarding public inspection of annual returns and reports. This includes redesignating paragraphs and adding a new paragraph about organizations required to file returns on magnetic media or in machine-readable form. The amendments made by subsection (a) in section 6104 require organizations to file returns on magnetic media or in machine-readable form. This applies to returns for taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 9. EXPANSION OF BAD CHECK PENALTY TO ELECTRONIC PAYMENTS, ETC. Amends Section 6657 to treat authorizations of payments by commercially acceptable means as bad checks. Effective for payments made after December 31, 2005.
